intro: Dregea sinensis var. corrugata, commonly known as the corrugated dregea, is a perennial plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite leaves with a rough, corrugated texture. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or woodland settings. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
